Abs.documentation: Calculates the absolute value of a number.
Abs.label: Abs(expression)

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

ACos.documentation: Calculates the arcCosine of a number.
ACos.label: ACos(expression)

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any value between -1 and 1 inclusive.

params.label: "function"
params.documentation: The name of the adlib function to be registered.

params.label: time
params.documentation: [optional] how often in milliseconds to call the function. Default is 250 ms.

params.label: function
params.documentation: [optional] The name of the adlib function to be Unregistered. See remarks for more information.

Asc.documentation: Returns the unicode code of a character.
Asc.label: Asc ( "char" )

params.label: char
params.documentation: The character to get the code for. If a string is used, the code for the first character is given.

AscW.documentation: Returns the ASCII code of a character.
AscW.label: AscW ( "char" )

params.label: char
params.documentation: The character to get the code for. If a string is used, the code for the first character is given.

ASin.label: ASin(expression)
ASin.documentation: Calculates the arcsine of a number.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any value between -1 and 1 (inclusive).

Assign.label: Assign ( "varname", "data" [, flag = 0] )
Assign.documentation: Assigns a variable by name with the data.

params.label: varname
params.documentation: The name of the variable you wish to assign. Cannot be an array element and must only contain letters, digits and underscore characters (as per normal variable naming conventions).

params.label: data
params.documentation: The data you wish to assign to the variable.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] controls the way that variables are assigned

ATan.label: ATan(expression)
ATan.documentation: Calculates the arctangent of a number.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

AutoItSetOption.label: AutoItSetOption ( "option" [, param] )
AutoItSetOption.documentation: Changes the operation of various AutoIt functions/parameters.

params.label: option
params.documentation: The option to change.

params.label: param
params.documentation: [optional] The value to assign to the option. The type and meaning vary by option. See remarks below. If the param is not provided, then the function just returns the value already assigned to the option. The keyword Default can be used for the parameter to reset the option to its default value.

AutoItWinSetTitle.label: AutoItWinSetTitle ( "newtitle" )
AutoItWinSetTitle.documentation: Changes the title of the AutoIt window.

params.label: newtitle
params.documentation: The new title to give to the window.

Beep.label: Beep ( [Frequency = 500 [, Duration = 1000]] )
Beep.documentation: Plays back a beep to the user.

params.label: Frequency
params.documentation: [optional] The frequency of the beep in hertz. Can be anywhere from 37 through 32,767 (0x25 through 0x7FFF). Default is 500 Hz.

params.label: Duration
params.documentation: [optional] The length of the beep in milliseconds. Default = 1000 ms.

Binary.label: Binary ( expression )
Binary.documentation: Returns the binary representation of an expression.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: An expression to convert into binary/byte data.

BinaryLen.label: BinaryLen ( binary )
BinaryLen.documentation: Returns the number of bytes in a binary variant.

params.label: binary
params.documentation: The binary data to evaluate.

BinaryMid.label: BinaryMid ( binary, start [, count] )
BinaryMid.documentation: Returns the number of bytes in a binary variant.

params.label: binary
params.documentation: The binary data to evaluate.

params.label: start
params.documentation: The byte position to start. (1 = first byte)

params.label: count
params.documentation: [optional] The number of bytes to extract. By default the entire remainder of the binary data.

BinaryToString.label: BinaryToString ( expression [, flag = 1] )
BinaryToString.documentation: Converts a binary variant into a string.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: An expression to convert into a string.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] Changes how the binary data is converted

params.label: value1
params.documentation: The first number.

params.label: value2
params.documentation: The second number.

params.label: value n
params.documentation: [optional] The nth number - up to 255 values can be specified.

params.label: value
params.documentation: The number to operate on.

params.label: value1
params.documentation: The first number.

params.label: value2
params.documentation: The second number.

params.label: value n
params.documentation: [optional] The nth number - up to 255 values can be specified.

params.label: value
params.documentation: The number to be operated on.

params.label: shift
params.documentation: [optional] Number of bits to rotate to the left (negative numbers rotate right). If not given, the default is 1.

params.label: size
params.documentation: [optional] A string that determines the rotation size, the default is (16 bits).

params.label: value
params.documentation: The number to be shifted.

params.label: shift
params.documentation: Number of bits to shift to the right (negative numbers shift left).

BitXOR.label: BitXOR ( value1, value2 [, value n] )
BitXOR.documentation: Performs a bitwise exclusive OR (XOR) operation.

params.label: value1
params.documentation: The first number.

params.label: value2
params.documentation: The second number.

params.label: value n
params.documentation: [optional] The nth number - up to 255 values can be specified.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: $BI_DISABLE (1) = Disable user input / $BI_ENABLE (0) = Enable user input

params.label: mode
params.documentation: Sets the script break mode: $BREAK_ENABLE (1) = Break is enabled (user can quit) (default) / $BREAK_DISABLE (0) = Break is disabled (user cannot quit)

Call.label: Call ( "function" [, paramN] )
Call.documentation: Calls a user-defined or built-in function contained in first parameter.

params.label: function
params.documentation: The name of function or function to call.

params.label: paramN
params.documentation: Argument(s) that will be passed to the function being invoked.

CDTray.label: CDTray ( "drive", "status" )
CDTray.documentation: Opens or closes the CD tray.

params.label: drive
params.documentation: The drive letter of the CD tray to control, in the format D:, E:, etc.

params.label: status
params.documentation: Specifies if you want the CD tray to be open or closed

Ceiling.label: Ceiling ( expression )
Ceiling.documentation: Returns a number rounded up to the next integer.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

Chr.label: Chr ( ASCIIcode )
Chr.documentation: Returns a character corresponding to an ASCII code.

params.label: ASCIIcode
params.documentation: An ASCII code in the range 0-255 (e.g., 65 returns the capital letter A).

ChrW.label: ChrW ( UNICODEcode  )
ChrW.documentation: Returns a character corresponding to a unicode code.

params.label: UNICODEcode
params.documentation: A unicode code in the range 0-65535 (e.g., 65 returns the capital letter A).

params.label: "value"
params.documentation: The text to write to the clipboard.

ConsoleRead.label: ConsoleRead ( [peek = False [, binary = False]] )
ConsoleRead.documentation: Read from the STDIN stream of the AutoIt script process.

params.label: peek
params.documentation: [optional] If True the function does not remove the read characters from the stream.

params.label: binary
params.documentation: [optional] If True the function reads the data as binary instead of text (default is text).

ConsoleWrite.label: ConsoleWrite ( "data" )
ConsoleWrite.documentation: Writes data to the STDOUT stream. Some text editors can read this stream as can other programs which may be expecting data on this stream.

params.label: data
params.documentation: The data you wish to output. This may either be text or binary.

ConsoleWriteError.label: ConsoleWriteError ( "data" )
ConsoleWriteError.documentation: Writes data to the STDERR stream. Some text editors can read this stream as can other programs which may be expecting data on this stream.

params.label: data
params.documentation: The data you wish to output. This may either be text or binary.

ControlClick.label: ControlClick ( "title", "text", controlID [, button = "left" [, clicks = 1 [, x [, y]]]] )
ControlClick.documentation: Sends a mouse click command to a given control.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: button
params.documentation: [optional] The button to click, "left", "right", "middle", "main", "menu", "primary", "secondary". Default is the left button.

params.label: clicks
params.documentation: [optional] The number of times to click the mouse. Default is 1.

params.label: x
params.documentation: [optional] The x position to click within the control. Default is center.

params.label: y
params.documentation: [optional] The y position to click within the control. Default is center.

ControlCommand.label: ControlCommand ( "title", "text", controlID, "command" [, "option"] )
ControlCommand.documentation: Sends a command to a control.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: command
params.documentation: The command to send to the control.

params.label: option
params.documentation: [optional] Additional parameter required by some commands.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

ControlFocus.label: ControlFocus ( "title", "text", controlID )
ControlFocus.documentation: Sets input focus to a given control on a window.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

ControlGetFocus.label: ControlGetFocus ( "title" [, "text"] )
ControlGetFocus.documentation: Returns the ControlRef# of the control that has keyboard focus within a specified window.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: [optional] The text of the window to access.

ControlGetHandle.label: ControlGetHandle ( "title", "text", controlID )
ControlGetHandle.documentation: Retrieves the internal handle of a control.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

ControlGetPos.label: ControlGetPos ( "title", "text", controlID )
ControlGetPos.documentation: Retrieves the position and size of a control relative to its window.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

ControlListView.label: ControlListView ( "title", "text", controlID, "command" [, option1 [, option2]] )
ControlListView.documentation: Sends a command to a ListView32 control.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: command
params.documentation: The command to send to the control.

params.label: option1
params.documentation: [optional] Additional parameter required by some commands.

params.label: option2
params.documentation: [optional] Additional parameter required by some commands.

ControlMove.label: ControlMove ( "title", "text", controlID, x, y [, width [, height]] )
ControlMove.documentation: Moves a control within a window.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: x
params.documentation: X coordinate to move to relative to the window client area.

params.label: y
params.documentation: Y coordinate to move to relative to the window client area.

params.label: width
params.documentation: [optional] New width of the window.

params.label: height
params.documentation: [optional] New height of the window.

ControlSend.label: ControlSend ( "title", "text", controlID, "string" [, flag = 0] )
ControlSend.documentation: Sends a string of characters to a control.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: string
params.documentation: String of characters to send to the control.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] Changes how "keys" is processed

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: new text
params.documentation: The new text to be set into the control.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] when different from 0 (default) will force the target window to be redrawn.

ControlShow.label: ControlShow ( "title", "text", controlID )
ControlShow.documentation: Shows a control that was hidden.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

ControlTreeView.label: ControlTreeView ( "title", "text", controlID, "command" [, option1] )
ControlTreeView.documentation: Sends a command to a TreeView32 control.

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title/hWnd/class of the window to access.

params.label: text
params.documentation: The text of the window to access.

params.label: controlID
params.documentation: The control to interact with.

params.label: command
params.documentation: The command to send to the control.

params.label: option1
params.documentation: [optional] Additional parameter required by some commands.

Cos.label: Cos ( expression )
Cos.documentation: Calculates the cosine of a number.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Value in radians.

Dec.label: Dec ( "hex" [, flag = 0] )
Dec.documentation: Returns a numeric representation of a hexadecimal string.

params.label: hex
params.documentation: The hexadecimal string to convert.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] Defines behavior.

DirCopy.label: DirCopy ( "source dir", "dest dir" [, flag = 0] )
DirCopy.documentation: Copies a directory and all sub-directories and files (Similar to xcopy).

params.label: source dir
params.documentation: Path of the source directory (with no trailing backslash). e.g. "C:\Path1"

params.label: dest dir
params.documentation: Path of the destination dir (with no trailing backslash). e.g. "C:\Path_Copy"

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines whether to overwrite files if they already exist

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of the directory to create.

DirGetSize.label: DirGetSize ( "path" [, flag = 0] )
DirGetSize.documentation: Returns the size in bytes of a given directory.

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of the directory to create.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines the behaviour and result of the function

DirMove.label: DirMove ( "source dir", "dest dir" [, flag = 0] )
DirMove.documentation: Copies a directory and all sub-directories and files (Similar to xcopy).

params.label: source dir
params.documentation: Path of the source directory (with no trailing backslash). e.g. "C:\Path1"

params.label: dest dir
params.documentation: Path of the destination dir (with no trailing backslash). e.g. "C:\Path_Copy"

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines whether to overwrite files if they already exist

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of the directory to remove.

params.label: recurse
params.documentation: [optional] Use this flag to specify if you want to delete sub-directories too.

DllCall.label: DllCall ( "dll", "return type", "function" [, type1, param1 [, type n, param n]] )
DllCall.documentation: Dynamically calls a function in a DLL.

params.label: dll
params.documentation: The filename of the DLL to use. e.g. "user32.dll". A handle obtained from DllOpen can also be used (See Remarks).

params.label: return type
params.documentation: The return type of the function

params.label: function
params.documentation: The name, eg. "MessageBox" or the ordinal value, e.g. 62, of the function in the DLL to call.

params.label: type1
params.documentation: [optional] The type of the parameter

params.label: param1
params.documentation: [optional] The actual parameter

params.label: type n
params.documentation: [optional] The type of the nth parameter

params.label: param n
params.documentation: [optional] The actual nth parameter

DllCallAddress.label: DllCallAddress ( "return type", address  [, type1, param1 [, type n, param n]] )
DllCallAddress.documentation: Dynamically calls a function in a DLL.

params.label: return type
params.documentation: The return type of the function

params.label: address
params.documentation: The address of a function.

params.label: type1
params.documentation: [optional] The type of the parameter

params.label: param1
params.documentation: [optional] The actual parameter

params.label: type n
params.documentation: [optional] The type of the nth parameter

params.label: param n
params.documentation: [optional] The actual nth parameter

DllCallbackFree.documentation: Frees a previously created handle created with DllCallbackRegister.
DllCallbackFree.label: DllCallbackFree ( handle )

params.label: handle
params.documentation: The DllCallback handle, as returned by a previous call to DllCallbackRegister().

DllCallbackGetPtr.documentation: Returns the pointer to a callback function that can be passed to the Win32 API.
DllCallbackGetPtr.label: DllCallbackGetPtr ( handle )

params.label: handle
params.documentation: A DllCallback handle returned from DllCallbackRegister().

DllCallbackRegister.label: DllCallbackRegister ( "function", "return type", "params" )
DllCallbackRegister.documentation: Creates a user-defined DLL Callback function.

params.label: function
params.documentation: The name of the User Defined Function to call.

params.label: return type
params.documentation: The return type and calling convention of the function

params.label: params
params.documentation: A semi-colon separated list of parameters that will be passed to this function.

params.label: dllhandle
params.documentation: The handle of a dll, as returned by a previous call to DllOpen().

DllOpen.label: DllOpen ( "filename" )
DllOpen.documentation: Opens a DLL file for use in DllCall.

params.label: filename
params.documentation: Filename of the DLL file to open.

DllStructCreate.documentation: Creates a C/C++ style structure to be used in DllCall.
DllStructCreate.label: DllStructCreate ( Struct [, Pointer] )

params.label: Struct
params.documentation: A string representing the structure to create.

params.label: Pointer
params.documentation: [optional] If supplied the struct will not allocate memory but use the pointer supplied.

DllStructGetData.documentation: Returns the data of an element of the struct.
DllStructGetData.label: DllStructGetData ( Struct, Element [, index = Default] )

params.label: Struct
params.documentation: The struct returned by DllStructCreate().

params.label: Element
params.documentation: Which element of the struct you want to access, starting at 1 or the element name as defined in DllStructCreate().

params.label: index
params.documentation: [optional] For elements that are an array this specifies the 1-based index to retrieve. If omitted or the Default keyword then the entire array is retrieved (Useful for quickly retrieving strings). Not used for non-array elements.

DllStructGetPtr.documentation: Returns the pointer to the struct or an element in the struct.
DllStructGetPtr.label: DllStructGetPtr ( Struct [, Element] )

params.label: Struct
params.documentation: The struct returned by DllStructCreate().

params.label: Element
params.documentation: [optional] The element of the struct whose pointer you need, starting at 1 or the element name as defined in DllStructCreate().

DllStructGetSize.documentation: Returns the size of the struct in bytes.
DllStructGetSize.label: DllStructGetSize ( Struct )

params.label: Struct
params.documentation: The struct returned by DllStructCreate().

DllStructSetData.documentation: Sets the data of an element in the struct.
DllStructSetData.label: DllStructSetData ( Struct, Element, value [, index] )

params.label: Struct
params.documentation: The struct returned by DllStructCreate().

params.label: Element
params.documentation: Which element of the struct you want to access, starting at 1, or the element name as defined in DllStructCreate().

params.label: value
params.documentation: The new value to place in the struct element.

params.label: index
params.documentation: [optional] For elements that are an array this specifies the 1-based index to set. If omitted or the Default keyword then as much of the value as possible will be set in element starting at index 1 (Useful for quickly setting strings). Not used for non-array elements.

DriveGetDrive.documentation: Returns an array containing the enumerated drives.
DriveGetDrive.label: DriveGetDrive ( "type" )

params.label: type
params.documentation: Type of drive to find

DriveGetFileSystem.documentation: Returns File System Type of a drive.
DriveGetFileSystem.label: DriveGetFileSystem ( "path" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to receive information from.

DriveGetLabel.documentation: Returns Volume Label of a drive, if it has one.
DriveGetLabel.label: DriveGetLabel ( "path" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to receive information from.

DriveGetSerial.documentation: Returns Serial Number of a drive.
DriveGetSerial.label: DriveGetSerial ( "path" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to receive information from.

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to receive information from.

params.label: operation
params.documentation: [optional] The drive type operation to perform.

params.label: device
params.documentation: The device to map, for example "O:" or "LPT1:". If you pass an empty string for this parameter a connection is made but not mapped to a specific drive. If you specify "*" an unused drive letter will be automatically selected.

params.label: remote share
params.documentation: The remote share to connect to in the form "\\server\share".

params.label: flags
params.documentation: [optional] A combination of the following: $DMA_DEFAULT (0) = default; $DMA_PERSISTENT (1) = Persistent mapping; $DMA_AUTHENTICATION (8) = Show authentication dialog if required

params.label: user
params.documentation: [optional] The username to use to connect. In the form "username" or "domain\username".

params.label: password
params.documentation: [optional] The password to use to connect.

params.label: drive
params.documentation: The device to disconnect, e.g. "O:" or "LPT1:".

DriveMapGet.documentation: Retrieves the details of a mapped drive.
DriveMapGet.label: DriveMapGet ( "device" )

params.label: device
params.documentation: The device (drive or printer) letter to query, e.g. "O:" or "LPT1:"

DriveSetLabel.documentation: Sets the Volume Label of a drive.
DriveSetLabel.label: DriveSetLabel ( "path", "label" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to change.

params.label: label
params.documentation: New volume label for the drive. (11 characters is usually max length)

DriveSpaceFree.documentation: Returns the free disk space of a path in Megabytes.
DriveSpaceFree.label: DriveSpaceFree ( "path" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to receive information from.

DriveSpaceTotal.documentation: Returns the total disk space of a path in Megabytes.
DriveSpaceTotal.label: DriveSpaceTotal ( "path" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to receive information from.

DriveStatus.documentation: Returns the status of the drive as a string.
DriveStatus.label: DriveStatus ( "path" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: Path of drive to receive information from.

params.label: envvariable
params.documentation: Name of the environment variable to get such as "TEMP" or "PATH".

params.label: envvariable
params.documentation: Name of the environment variable to set.

params.label: value
params.documentation: [optional] Value to set the environment variable to. If a value is not used the environment variable will be deleted.

Eval.documentation: Return the value of the variable defined by a string.
Eval.label: Eval ( string )

params.label: string
params.documentation: string representing name of the variable.

params.label: string
params.documentation: string representing an expression to be evaluated.

Exp.documentation: Calculates e to the power of a number.
Exp.label: Exp ( expression )

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

params.label: path
params.documentation: The path to make the current working directory.

params.label: filehandle
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

params.label: source
params.documentation: The source path of the file(s) to copy. (* and ? wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

params.label: dest
params.documentation: The destination path of the copied file(s).

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines whether to overwrite files if they already exist.

FileCreateNTFSLink.documentation: Creates an NTFS hardlink to a file or a directory.
FileCreateNTFSLink.label: FileCreateNTFSLink ( "source", "hardlink" [, flag = 0] )

params.label: source
params.documentation: Path of the source to which the hardlink will be created.

params.label: hardlink
params.documentation: Path of the hardlink.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines whether to overwrite link if they already exist.

FileCreateShortcut.documentation: Creates a shortcut (.lnk) to a file.
FileCreateShortcut.label: FileCreateShortcut ( "file", "lnk" [, "workdir" [, "args" [, "desc" [, "icon" [, "hotkey" [, icon number [, state]]]]]]] )

params.label: file
params.documentation: Full path and file name of file to which the shortcut will point.

params.label: lnk
params.documentation: Full path and file name of the shortcut.

params.label: workdir
params.documentation: [optional] Working directory.

params.label: args
params.documentation: [optional] Additional file arguments.

params.label: desc
params.documentation: [optional] File Description.

params.label: icon
params.documentation: [optional] Full Path/File name of icon to use.

params.label: hotkey
params.documentation: [optional] Hotkey - same as the Send() key format.

params.label: icon number
params.documentation: [optional] The icon instance to use (usually 0)

params.label: state
params.documentation: [optional] The state the shortcut is launched in. Use either @SW_SHOWNORMAL, @SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE or @SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED

params.label: filename
params.documentation: The path of the file(s) to delete.

FileExists.documentation: Checks if a file or directory exists.
FileExists.label: FileExists ( "path" )

params.label: path
params.documentation: The directory or file to check.

FileFindFirstFile.documentation: Creates a search handle, defined by a path and file mask.
FileFindFirstFile.label: FileFindFirstFile ( "filename" )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: The path and file name.

FileFindNextFile.documentation: Returns the next filename defined by the search handle.
FileFindNextFile.label: FileFindNextFile ( search [, flag = 0])

params.label: search
params.documentation: The search handle, as returned by FileFindFirstFile().

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines whether to return detailed file attribute information in @extended.

FileFlush.documentation: Flushes the file's buffer to disk.
FileFlush.label: FileFlush ( "filehandle" )

params.label: filehandle
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

FileGetAttrib.documentation: Returns a code string representing a file's attributes.
FileGetAttrib.label: FileGetAttrib ( "filename" )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: The path to the file or directory to check.

FileGetEncoding.documentation: Determines the text encoding used in a file.
FileGetEncoding.label: FileGetEncoding ( "filehandle/filename" [, mode = 1] )

params.label: filehandle/filename
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen(). Alternatively you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

params.label: mode
params.documentation: [optional] The UTF8 detection mode to use.

FileGetLongName.documentation: Returns the long path+name of the path+name passed.
FileGetLongName.label: FileGetLongName ( "filename" [, flag = 0] )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: Full path and file name to convert

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] $FN_FULLPATH (0) - Default; $FN_RELATIVEPATH (1) - file can have relative dir, e.g. ".. ile.txt"

params.label: filehandle
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

params.label: lnk
params.documentation: Full path and file name of the shortcut.

FileGetShortName.documentation: Returns the 8.3 short path+name of the path+name passed.
FileGetShortName.label: FileGetShortName ( "filename" [, flag = 0] )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: full path and file name to convert

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] $FN_FULLPATH (0) - Default; $FN_RELATIVEPATH (1) - file can have relative dir, e.g. ".. ile.txt"

FileGetSize.documentation: Returns the size of a file in bytes.
FileGetSize.label: FileGetSize ( "filename" )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: Filename to check.

FileGetTime.documentation: Returns the time and date information for a file.
FileGetTime.label: FileGetTime ( "filename" [, option = 0 [, format = 0]] )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: The path to the file or directory to check.

params.label: option
params.documentation: [optional] Flag to indicate which timestamp: $FT_MODIFIED (0) = Last modified (default); $FT_CREATED (1) = Created; $FT_ACCESSED (2) = Last accessed

FileGetVersion.documentation: Returns version information stored in a file.
FileGetVersion.label: FileGetVersion ( "filename" [, "stringname"] )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: Filename.

params.label: stringname
params.documentation: [optional] Name of the string field to be retrieved from the header version file info: $FV_COMMENTS ("Comments"); $FV_COMPANYNAME ("CompanyName"); $FV_FILEDESCRIPTION ("FileDescription"); $FV_FILEVERSION ("FileVersion"); $FV_INTERNALNAME ("InternalName"); $FV_LEGALCOPYRIGHT ("LegalCopyright"); $FV_LEGALTRADEMARKS ("LegalTrademarks"); $FV_ORIGINALFILENAME ("OriginalFilename"); $FV_PRODUCTNAME ("ProductName"); $FV_PRODUCTVERSION ("ProductVersion"); $FV_PRIVATEBUILD ("PrivateBuild"); $FV_SPECIALBUILD ("SpecialBuild")

FileInstall.documentation: Include and install a file with the compiled script.
FileInstall.label: FileInstall ( "source", "dest" [, flag = 0] )

params.label: source
params.documentation: The source path of the file to compile. This must be a literal string; it cannot be a variable or the result of a function call. It can be a relative path (using .\ or ..\ in the path) to the source file (.au3).

params.label: dest
params.documentation: The destination path of the file with trailing backslash if only the directory is used. This can be a variable.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines whether to overwrite files if they already exist: $FC_NOOVERWRITE (0) = (default) do not overwrite existing files; $FC_OVERWRITE (1) = overwrite existing files

params.label: source
params.documentation: The source path and filename of the file to move. (* wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

params.label: dest
params.documentation: The destination path and filename of the moved file. (* wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] this flag determines whether to overwrite files if they already exist: Can be a combination of the following: $FC_NOOVERWRITE (0) = (default) do not overwrite existing files.; $FC_OVERWRITE (1) = overwrite existing files.; $FC_CREATEPATH (8) = Create destination directory structure if it doesn't exist (See Remarks).

FileOpen.documentation: Opens a file for reading or writing.
FileOpen.label: FileOpen ( "filename" [, mode = 0] )

params.label: filename
params.documentation: Filename of the file to open.

params.label: mode
params.documentation: [optional] Mode to open the file in.

params.label: title
params.documentation: Title text of the Dialog GUI.

params.label: init dir
params.documentation: Initial directory selected in the GUI file tree.

params.label: filter
params.documentation: File type single filter such as "All (*.*)" or "Text files (*.txt)" or multiple filter groups such as "All (*.*)|Text files (*.txt)" (See Remarks).

params.label: options
params.documentation: [optional] Dialog Options: To use more than one option, BitOR the required values together.; $FD_FILEMUSTEXIST (1) = File Must Exist (if user types a filename); $FD_PATHMUSTEXIST (2) = Path Must Exist (if user types a path, ending with a backslash); $FD_MULTISELECT (4) = Allow MultiSelect; $FD_PROMPTCREATENEW (8) = Prompt to Create New File (if does not exist)

params.label: default name
params.documentation: [optional] Suggested file name for the user to open. Default is blank ("").

params.label: hwnd
params.documentation: [optional] The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

FileRead.documentation: Read in a number of characters from a previously opened file.
FileRead.label: FileRead ( "filehandle/filename" [, count] )

params.label: filehandle/filename
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen(). Alternatively you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

params.label: count
params.documentation: [optional] The number of characters to read. See remarks.

FileReadLine.documentation: Read in a line of text from a previously opened text file.
FileReadLine.label: FileReadLine ( "filehandle/filename" [, line = 1] )

params.label: filehandle/filename
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen(). Alternatively you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

params.label: line
params.documentation: [optional] The line number to read. The first line of a text file is line 1 (not zero), last line is -1.

FileReadToArray.documentation: Reads the specified file into an array.
FileReadToArray.label: FileReadToArray ( "filehandle/filename" )

params.label: filehandle/filename
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen(). Alternatively you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

FileRecycle.documentation: Sends a file or directory to the recycle bin.
FileRecycle.label: FileRecycle ( "source" )

params.label: source
params.documentation: The source path of the file(s) or directory to Recycle. (* and ? wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

params.label: source
params.documentation: [optional] The rootpath to empty - if omitted the recycle bin for all drives is emptied.

params.label: title
params.documentation: Title text of the Dialog GUI.

params.label: init dir
params.documentation: Initial directory selected in the GUI file tree.

params.label: filter
params.documentation: File type single filter such as "All (*.*)" or "Text files (*.txt)" or multiple filter groups such as "All (*.*)|Text files (*.txt)" (See Remarks).

params.label: options
params.documentation: [optional] Dialog Options: To use more than one option, BitOR the required values together. $FD_PATHMUSTEXIST (2) = Path Must Exist (if user types a path, ending with a backslash) $FD_PROMPTOVERWRITE (16) = Prompt to OverWrite FileConstants are defined in FileConstants.au3.

params.label: default name
params.documentation: [optional] File name to suggest to the user to save the file with. Default is blank ("").

params.label: hwnd
params.documentation: [optional] The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

FileSelectFolder.documentation: Initiates a Browse For Folder dialog.
FileSelectFolder.label: FileSelectFolder ( "dialog text", "root dir" [, flag = 0 [, "initial dir" [, hwnd]]] )

params.label: dialog text
params.documentation: Text greeting in dialog.

params.label: root dir
params.documentation: Root directory of GUI file tree. It limits a choice in the root folder. Use "" for Desktop to be root.

params.label: flag
params.documentation: [optional] $FSF_CREATEBUTTON (1) = Show Create Folder Button (XP only) $FSF_NEWDIALOG (2) = Use New Dialog Style (XP only) $FSF_EDITCONTROL (4) = Show Edit Control (XP only)Constants are defined in FileConstants.au3.

params.label: initial dir
params.documentation: [optional] The full path of the folder you selected/highlighted when displaying dialogue (if it exists in the root folder). Default is blank ("").

params.label: hwnd
params.documentation: [optional] The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

FileSetAttrib.documentation: Sets the attributes of one or more files/directories.
FileSetAttrib.label: FileSetAttrib ( "file pattern", "+-RASHNOT" [, recurse = 0] )

params.label: file pattern
params.documentation: The path of the file(s) to set, e.g. C:\*.au3, C:\Dir. (* and ? wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

params.label: +-RASHNOT
params.documentation: Attribute(s) to set/clear. e.g. "+A", "+RA-SH"

params.label: recurse
params.documentation: [optional] $FT_NONRECURSIVE (0) - no recursion (Default) $FT_RECURSIVE (1) - directories are recursed into. Constants are defined in FileConstants.au3.

FileSetEnd.documentation: Sets the end of the file at the current file position.
FileSetEnd.label: FileSetEnd ( "filehandle" )

params.label: filehandle
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

params.label: filehandle
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

params.label: offset
params.documentation: The offset to move from the origin. This value may be positive or negative. Negative values move backwards from the origin.

params.label: origin
params.documentation: Must be one of the following: $FILE_BEGIN (0) = Beginning of the file. $FILE_CURRENT (1) = Current position. $FILE_END (2) = End of the file. Constants are defined in FileConstants.au3.

FileSetTime.documentation: Sets the timestamp of one of more files.
FileSetTime.label: FileSetTime ( "file pattern", "time" [, type = 0 [, recurse = 0]] )

params.label: file pattern
params.documentation: The path of the file(s) to set, e.g. C:\*.au3, C:\Dir. (* and ? wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

params.label: time
params.documentation: The new time to set in the format "YYYYMMDDHHMMSS" (Year, month, day, hours (24hr clock), seconds). If the time is blank "" then the current time is used.

params.label: type
params.documentation: [optional] The timestamp to change: $FT_MODIFIED (0) = Last modified (default) $FT_CREATED (1) = Created $FT_ACCESSED (2) = Last accessedConstants are defined in FileConstants.au3

params.label: recurse
params.documentation: [optional] $FT_NONRECURSIVE (0) - no recursion (Default). $FT_RECURSIVE (1) - directories are recursed into. Constants are defined in FileConstants.au3

FileWrite.documentation: Write text/data to the end of a previously opened file.
FileWrite.label: FileWrite ( "filehandle/filename", "text/data" )

params.label: filehandle/filename
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen(). Alternatively, you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

params.label: text/data
params.documentation: The text/data to write to the file. The text is written as is - no @CR or @LF characters are added. See remark for data type.

FileWriteLine.documentation: Append a line of text to the end of a previously opened text file.
FileWriteLine.label: FileWriteLine ( "filehandle/filename", "line" )

params.label: filehandle/filename
params.documentation: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen(). Alternatively, you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

params.label: line
params.documentation: The line of text to write to the text file. If the line does NOT end in @CR or @LF then a DOS linefeed (@CRLF) will be automatically added.

Floor.documentation: Returns a number rounded down to the closest integer.
Floor.label: Floor ( expression )

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

FtpSetProxy.documentation: Sets the internet proxy to use for ftp access.
FtpSetProxy.label: FtpSetProxy ( mode = 0 [, "proxy:port" [, "username" [, "password"]]] )

params.label: mode
params.documentation: The proxy mode to use: $PROXY_IE (0) = (default) Use current Internet Explorer settings for proxy. $PROXY_NONE (1) = Use no proxy (direct access) $PROXY_SPECIFIED (2) = Use the proxy specifiedConstants are deined in "AutoItConstants.au3".

params.label: proxy:port
params.documentation: [optional] The address and port of the proxy to use. See remarks below.

params.label: username
params.documentation: [optional] If required, the username for the proxy

params.label: password
params.documentation: [optional] If required, the password for the proxy

FuncName.documentation: Returns the name of a function stored in a variable.
FuncName.label: FuncName ( $Functionvariable )

params.label: $Functionvariable
params.documentation: A variable containing a Function whose name you want to retrieve.

params.label: "keys"
params.documentation: The sequence of keys to send.

params.label: flag = 0
params.documentation: [optional] Changes how "keys" is processed
